gov.sandia.cognition.statistics

Interface RandomVariable<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - Type of data that can be sampled from the distribution.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, CloneableSerializable, Distribution<DataType>, Ring<RandomVariable<DataType>>, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRandomVariable, UnivariateRandomVariable

    @PublicationReference(author="Wikipedia",
                      title="Random variable",
                      type=WebPage,
                      year=2009,
                      url="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Random_variable")
public interface RandomVariable<DataType>
extends Distribution<DataType>, Ring<RandomVariable<DataType>>
    Describes the functionality of a random variable. That is, a distribution that can be mathematically manipulated by other random variables using the "Ring" operations.
    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Kevin R. Dixon

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface gov.sandia.cognition.statistics.Distribution

        sample, sample, sampleInto

      • Methods inherited from interface gov.sandia.cognition.math.Ring

        clone, dotTimes, dotTimesEquals, equals, equals, isZero, isZero, minus, minusEquals, negative, negativeEquals, plus, plusEquals, scale, scaledMinus, scaledMinusEquals, scaledPlus, scaledPlusEquals, scaleEquals, zero
